fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.themes

Interface IThemeService


  • @SystemService
public interface IThemeService
    Provides access to template systems.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent read/write access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Field Detail

      • THEME_ASSETS_FOLDER

        static final String THEME_ASSETS_FOLDER
        Folder name for physical directory for theme pack assets.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IConfigService.getAssetsPath(), Constant Field Values

      • THEME_MEDIA_URI

        static final String THEME_MEDIA_URI
        Relative URI for accessing theme media content.

        Content for template packages is made available by appending the path of media content to this base URI. The path to media content is accessible via the theme file system.

        This base URI is relative to the embedded HTTP server's endpoint. It starts and ends with "/".

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        KEY_THEME_MEDIA_URI, IFileSystemService.MEDIA_ASSETS_URI, Constant Field Values

      • KEY_THEME_MEDIA_URI

        static final String KEY_THEME_MEDIA_URI
        The template data context key that should be used to pass a reference to the base content URI of an attached ITemplatePackage when merging template data into a template file.

        This will be relative to the base URI for all themes, followed by the theme pack name.

        The value associated with this key starts and ends with "/".

        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        ITemplateData.put(String, Object), ITemplateFile.merge(ITemplateData, java.io.Writer), THEME_MEDIA_URI, Constant Field Values

      • getThemeFileSystem

        IFileSystemView getThemeFileSystem()
        Gets the virtual theme filesystem, for navigating template systems, template packages and files, and style packages and style sheets.

        This filesystem is a logical abstraction of the content made available by template systems. Its content may be navigated as follows:

        • The root contains file system nodes that map to currently-available template systems.
        • Template system nodes contain folders representing currently-available template packages.
        • Template package nodes contain:
          • a "style" folder, containing subfolders representing currently-available style packages.
          • a "media" folder, containing arbitrary files and folders referred to by templates.
          • files representing currently-available template files.
        • Style package nodes contain:
          • a "media" folder, containing arbitrary files and folders referred to by stylesheets.
          • files representing currently-available stylesheets.

        This filesystem should be used to provide an IAddressableService to access theme-related styles and media. Hidden nodes in the filesystem should not be exposed (a hidden folder implies that all of its content is hidden, recursively).

        Returns:
        the virtual theme filesystem.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPath.as(Class)

      • attachTemplatePackage

        void attachTemplatePackage(String packageName,
                           String templateSystemName)
                    throws IOException,
                           UnsupportedThemePackageException,
                           IllegalArgumentException
        Attaches template package to the specified template system. This overrides automatic attachment rules, removing any existing attachment.

        At attachment time, the template system must exist but there is no requirement that any resources exist for the template package in the theme assets folder.

        If the resources exist at attachment time, and if the package has not yet been added to the target template system, then this method will try to add the package to the target template system automatically.

        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the package. If packed (a ".zip" package for example), then the name of the extension should not be included here.
        templateSystemName - the name of the target template system.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedThemePackageException - if the specified template system is not available or does not support the specified package.
        IOException - if an unsuccessful attempt is made to add the template package to the target template system.
        IllegalArgumentException - if either the template system name (or the package name) is null or empty, or if no such template system can be found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isAttachmentDefined(String, String), detachTemplatePackage(String), dropTemplatePackage(java.lang.String), ITemplateSystem.addTemplatePackage(String), ITemplateSystem.addTemplatePackage(String, java.io.InputStream), IPackage.getPackageName()

      • isAssetDefined

        boolean isAssetDefined(String packageName)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Indicates if the named template package is available in the theme assets folder, in either imported or expanded form.

        A template package is considered to be available if the theme assets folder contains either a matching ".zip" file (imported form), or a subfolder of the same name (expanded form).

        This does not indicate that the asset has actually been attached (it can be either attached or unattached, or in transition between any state).

        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the template package to verify.
        Returns:
        true if the package is available for attachment, or has already been attached (or is in transition), otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name contains disallowed characters (see getPackageName().
        Since:
        1.0

      • isAttachmentDefined

        boolean isAttachmentDefined(String packageName,
                            String templateSystemName)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Indicates if the named template package has been explicitly attached to the named template system (and not automatically attached).
        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the template package to verify.
        templateSystemName - name of the template system to verify. If null, then this method just checks if any (unspecified) attachment has been defined.
        Returns:
        true if explicit attachment via attachTemplatePackage(String, String) currently applies, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name contains disallowed characters (see getPackageName().
        Since:
        1.0

      • detachTemplatePackage

        void detachTemplatePackage(String packageName)
                    throws IllegalArgumentException
        Detaches a template package from any template system to which it may currently be attached, and permanently excludes it from automatic attachment in the future. If no such package exists, this method returns without error. If it exists but is not currently attached to any template system, then no changes are performed.
        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the package to detach.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the package is attached to a unmodifiable template system.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name contains disallowed characters (see getPackageName().
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        isDetachmentDefined(String), attachTemplatePackage(String, String)

      • isDetachmentDefined

        boolean isDetachmentDefined(String packageName)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Indicates if the named template package has been explicitly marked as detached, which has the effect of disabling automatic attachment for the named package.
        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the template package to check.
        Returns:
        true if explicit detachment via detachTemplatePackage(String) currently applies, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name contains disallowed characters (see getPackageName().
        Since:
        1.0

      • dropTemplatePackage

        void dropTemplatePackage(String packageName)
                  throws IOException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Drops an already-uploaded template package, deleting any associated files.

        If the template package is currently attached to any template system, then the package will be removed (by notification) from the template system first. If no such package exists, this method returns without error. If it exists but is not currently attached to any template system, then the files are simply deleted with no other visible changes.

        Parameters:
        packageName - name of package to remove. If imported (a ".zip" package for example), then the name of the extension should not be included here.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the package exists and cannot be removed.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the package name contains disallowed characters (see getPackageName().
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTemplatePackage

        ITemplatePackage getTemplatePackage(String packageName)
        Gets the named template package, if an implementation is currently available. All template systems associated with this theme service will be searched.
        Parameters:
        packageName - the name of the package to find.
        Returns:
        the template package implementation, provided by a template system, if a matching implementation can be found, or null.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IPackage.getPackageName()

      • getTemplate

        ITemplateFile getTemplate(UUID attachId)
        Gets a template file using its unique attachment ID. All template packages in all template systems associated with this theme service will be searched.
        Parameters:
        attachId - the non-null attachment ID.
        Returns:
        the matching template, or null if no match can currently be found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IAttachable.getAttachId()

      • getStyleSheet

        IStyleSheet getStyleSheet(UUID attachId)
        Gets a stylesheet using its unique attachment ID. All style packages in all template packages in all template systems associated with this theme service will be searched.
        Parameters:
        attachId - the non-null attachment ID.
        Returns:
        the matching stylesheet, or null if no match can currently be found.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        IAttachable.getAttachId()
